relation: configure terminal Example: Switch# configure terminal
flow exporter exporter-name Example: Switch(config)# flow exporter TestNetFlowExporterName
description description Example: Switch(config-flow-exporter)# description SampleNetFlowExporterDescription
destination {hostname | ip-address} vrf vrf-name Example: Switch(config-flow-exporter)# destination 198.51.100.120 vrf SampleVrfName
option {exporter-stats | interface-table | sampler-table} timeout seconds] Example: Switch(config-flow-exporter)# option exporter-stats timeout 600
template data timeout seconds Example: Switch(config-flow-exporter)# template data timeout 600 Switch(config-flow-exporter)#
transport udp udp-port Example: Switch(config-flow-exporter)# transport udp 67
Creates the flow exporter and enters Flexible NetFlow flow exporter configuration mode. This command can also modify an existing flow exporter.
(Optional) Configures a description for the exporter that appears in the configuration and in the display of the show flow exporter command.
(Optional) Configures differentiated services code point (DSCP) parameters for datagrams sent by the exporter. The DSCP range is from 0 to 63. The default is 0.
(Optional) Specifies the local interface from which the exporter uses the IP address as the source IP address for exported datagrams.
(Optional) Configures options data parameters for the exporter. You can configure all three options concurrently. The range for the timeout is 1 to 86400 seconds. The default is 600.
Configures export-protocol parameters for the exporter.
(Optional) Configures re-sending of templates based on a timeout. The range is 1 to 86400 seconds (86400 seconds equals 24 hours). The default is 600.
Specifies the UDP port on which the destination system is listening for exported datagrams. The range for udp-port is from 1 to 65536.
(Optional) Configures the time-to-live (TTL) value for datagrams sent by the exporter. The range is from 1 to 255 seconds. The default is 255.
Returns to privileged EXEC mode. Alternatively, you can also press Ctrl-Z to exit global configuration mode.
pageTitle: IPv6 Configuration Guide, Cisco IOS XE Release 3.6E (Catalyst 3850 Switches) - Configuring IPv6 NetFlow [Cisco Catalyst 3850 Series Switches] - Cisco
textBeforeTable: DETAILED STEPS 13.    end 12.    collect transport tcp flags {ack | cwr | ece | fin | psh | rst | syn | urg} 11.    collect interface [input | output] 10.    collect timestamp absolute [first | last] 9.    collect counter {bytes [ layer2 | long] | packets [ long]} 8.    match flow direction 7.    match interface [input |output] 6.    match transport [destination-port | icmp | source-port] 5.    match datalink [dot1q | ethertype | mac | vlan] 4.    match{ipv4 | ipv6}{destination | hop-limit | protocol | source | traffic-class| version} address 3.    description description 2.    flow record recordname 1.    configure terminal SUMMARY STEPS The following steps configure the customized flow record: Some NetFlow collectors require this information in the flow record. A value of 0
textAfterTable: Switch(config)# flow record Switch(config-flow-record)# description record to monitor network traffic Switch(config-flow-record)# match ipv6 destination address Switch(config-flow-record)# match datalink [dot1q | ethertype | mac | vlan] Switch(config-flow-record)# match transport [destination-port | icmp |igmp | source-port] Switch(config-flow-record)# match interface input Switch(config-flow-record)# match flow direction Switch(config-flow-record)#collect counter bytes layer2 long Switch(config-flow-record)# collect timestamp absolute first Switch(config-flow-record)# collect interface [input | output] Switch(config-flow-record)# collect transport tcp flags ack Switch(config-flow-record)# end Related Concepts IPv6 Netflow Related Tasks Configuring the Flow Exporters Configuring a Customized Flow Monitor Applying a Flow Monitor to an Interface Configuring the Flow Exporters The following steps are used to configure the NetFlow exporter. Note The optional export-protocol flow exporter configuration command specifies the NetFlow export protocol used by the exporter. The switch supports only netflow-v9. Though visible in the CLI help, netflow-5 is not supported. SUMMARY STEPS 1.    configure terminal 2.    flow exporter exporter-name 3.    description description 4.    destination {hostname | ip-address}
